title: Project Ashe Skin Rip off
body:
So apparently, Project Ashe is a legendary skin because they made an entirely new V.O Script and an auto toggle for hood. 

I feel like I'm being cheated now. If I'm going to pay 500RP more, at least make the hood toggle manual...

Thoughts anyone?

My source of information is directly from KateyKhaos herself on twitter.

replies.body:
New VO, New Lines, New Model, New taunt,joke, dance (btw: BEST DANCE IN GAME), new particle effects on everything, new recall and respawn.


**AKA: EVERYTHING THAT EVERY OTHER LEGENDARY SKIN HAS!!!**

That's correct, the hood isn't a manual toggle. It toggleswhen you're in enemy territory. 

To clarify, PROJECT: Ashe is considered a legendary skin due to what lightdragoon88 had mentioned below - 

- New model and texture
- New animations
- New particles on her kit
- New SFX on her kid
- New VO script (entirely new lines)
- VO processing.

> I don't think its that hard to type a few lines of script for her new voice over...

Not quite how this one works. :P For new VO, we hire a voice actor/actress and have them run through the script of VO lines that we've written. Some may need to be done several times to get it right/what we're looking for. The lines are then edited, processed and added into the game. 

> and the auto toggle hood is not something entirely unprecedented. So I can't seem to reason it to be worth.

Correct, it isn't. Neon Strike Vi, DJ Sona and Nighthunter Rengar both have /t abilities. We felt this was a unique opportunity to use a toggle, just in a different way.

> Not quite how this one works. :P For new VO, we fire a voice actor/actress...

> 
> Correct, it isn't. Neon Strike Vi, DJ Sona and Nighthunter Rengar both have /t abilities. We felt this was a unique opportunity to use a toggle, just in a different way.

I dont mean to be rude but why not just make a toggle.... Writing a code/script for the toggle would probably take less than 5 minutes lol.
As I'd mentioned above, we felt it was another way to use the toggle this time around. You're right, we could have done it the other way, but we chose to take a different direction with it.
Any particular reason why or did you guys just want to try something new?
We're always looking to push skins to the next level by providing unique content, as opposed to doing the same thing over and over.
Ugh. I was hoping you had an actual reason. Change for the sake of change isn't something to strive towards, Katey.
But it's a cool little feature. I think it's awesome.
It's a matter of opinion, of course. I'd prefer it just be a manual toggle, as I prefer having the hood up at all times instead of just 'when I'm pushing or winning'.
But then it's a reward. Do good, and you will get it.
I wasn't aware that I should have to do well to get something I paid 20 bucks for.

First off you don't have to pay $20 for it you can just not get it or get it through the crafting.
Second the fact that it toggles according to pushing or not is amazing because it plays into her being relaxed in her own territory and on guard/hunting in enemy territory.

Love the new ideas can't wait to see it in action.

Don't mind the Hellioning's of the community. Haters gonna hate.

Do you not understand how opinions work?

Why am I not allowed to say I don't like something?

you can mention you don't like something but to attack the maker of it just because she implemented it in a why you didn't like is just being rude.

Plus no where did i say you can't voice your opinion. I just pointed out how you don't have to rage about it because you don't have to pay for it (the skin) and can just get it another way.

Odd you feel I can't voice my opinion on when you said.

P.S. If you had just taken the time to read any of the other posts about the new skin you would have seen why they wanted to implement it the way they did.

Where am I raging? Where did I attack Katey?

I didn't call you a 'hater'. You called me that.
Hellioning sure likes his complaining, but he's doing it in a polite and considerate way. I stand with him on this one...

To your comment further down, I do agree that it's a matter of opinion. I'd disagree that it's for the sake of change. In this case, we found an interesting opportunity to control how the hood would toggle, and thought it was cool. It also makes this particular legendary more unique, as it's the only skin in the game that has this type of toggle functionality.
Eh. I'd think it'd make more sense for a Quinn skin. You know 'behind enemy lines'? Or maybe a stealth champion. Not Ashe, who's supposed to be with her team at basically all times.

I had a different thought on this actually. 
There are many ways to dive into this opinion matter.

I personally wanted the manual toggle because I thought it'd be cool say:
If I was in a losing lane, but had the potential of making a comeback, my ashe hood is off atm. And once I see the golden opportunity coming I toggle my hood on "use my R(Ashe Arrow)" and stun the enemy and get a kill.

^A little bit unrealistic because like come on...who in the world is going to remember to toggle their hood in the middle of an opportunity?

But doesn't matter. For this skin in particular, with many people's concern, I think Riot should at least create a POLL on this to see what the community thinks whether it should be a manual toggle or automatic toggle? 

I just find the idea dumb like if I'm losing in this particular game, my hood will ALWAYS BE OFF because i'd most likely be in range of a allied structure vs. if I'm pushing constantly my hood will always be on because I'd be away. 

Lately, I've been experiencing game winning situations where I'd still have 3k gold in my pocket and I still haven't backed yet. I think being able to take the helm off in a situation like this is some sort of relief to the champion(player) because it's a way to know that they're winning and the hood is not necessary to be on. (just an overstretched thought)

It does make the legendary more unique in that aspect, but why wouldn't it? It'll be the first skin to have an automatic toggle of course it is unique.

Then again, it is also a matter of opinion whether it is a good thing or bad thing, but it seems that majority of the community aren't really too fond of it. Some just don't care enough to complain because the skin it self looks good.  

I'm not saying that it isn't a unique idea or a bad idea. By all means this something Riot wants to do.

I just think since I am paying for this skin, along with everyone else we should be able to voice our opinion to Riot where they respectfully consider what we're addressing instead of saying "We have no plans on making that happen"

I really do hope that the delay of the skins is revolving around this matter. But I also did hear that they're improving Kat's skin hence the delay. I don't know.

Thanks for leaving this feedback - it's a great opportunity for us to learn and have solid 1:1 conversations. ^-^ 

> I personally wanted the manual toggle because I thought it'd be cool say:
If I was in a losing lane, but had the potential of making a comeback, my ashe hood is off atm. And once I see the golden opportunity coming I toggle my hood on "use my R(Ashe Arrow)" and stun the enemy and get a kill.

I 100% agree that would be a sweet scenario! 

> ^A little bit unrealistic because like come on...who in the world is going to remember to toggle their hood in the middle of an opportunity?

Right - and in DJ Sona's case, you needed to be out of combat for ~2 seconds before the toggle would be enabled. (Not sure if there's a delay on Vi or Rengar 'cause they're hooked up to /taunt). If we did it how we did the most recent toggle (DJ Sona), it's likely we'd implement a delay, so you aren't toggling in the middle of a team fight. :P

> But doesn't matter. For this skin in particular, with many people's concern, I think Riot should at least create a POLL on this to see what the community thinks whether it should be a manual toggle or automatic toggle?

It's a bit too late for this particular skin, as she's nearly about to unlock and become available. I do think this is an interesting conversation we can have, and something we could accommodate. I mean, we have done polls in the past for picking a champion who'd be either fire or ice themed based on All Star! 

> I just find the idea dumb like if I'm losing in this particular game, my hood will ALWAYS BE OFF because i'd most likely be in range of a allied structure vs. if I'm pushing constantly my hood will always be on because I'd be away.

That's fair feedback. That said, each game will be different, and there will be instances where you have it always on, always off, or a mix, depending on how your games go. 

> Then again, it is also a matter of opinion whether it is a good thing or bad thing, but it seems that majority of the community aren't really too fond of it. Some just don't care enough to complain because the skin it self looks good.

To play devil's advocate here, a lot of people who are content with something won't go out of their way to talk about it, resulting a lot of times in a loud minority. Don't get me wrong, I have seen a fair chunk of feedback about the toggle and how a manual toggle was preferred. 

> I just think since I am paying for this skin, along with everyone else we should be able to voice our opinion to Riot where they respectfully consider what we're addressing instead of saying "We have no plans on making that happen"

You're absolutely encouraged to voice your opinion! We do have discussions around the feedback given for every single skin. Myself and other QA folks actually compile feedback into emails and we have face to face discussions about the changes players have suggested. 

In some cases, we do agree something is the right call - adding a jade dragon tattoo to Firecracker Jinx, for example.  I think a better case of listening to feedback would be taking back the SKT skins and making changes to all of them, making a new ADC skin, and adding Azir!  In other cases, we disagree and do not make a change. We do hear you guys out every patch, though. 

> I really do hope that the delay of the skins is revolving around this matter. But I also did hear that they're improving Kat's skin hence the delay. I don't know.

There wasn't a delay - the skins weren't scheduled to come out until later this patch. Content doesn't always unlock at the beginning of a patch. No additional changes were made to Ashe or Kat after the current patch went live. 

We [did make changes to Kat](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/8EiikEyI-project-katarina-activate-pbe-testing?comment=0023), suggested by players, while she was still in development.

10/10 Response. Thank you for taking the time to address my long statement. At the end of the day it is a good skin. Heh, I figured it is already too late since the skin is coming out tomorrow. If only the Ashe suggestions were taken and changed as well! but oh wells! I'm glad we were able to have this conversation, so I at least know what is going on in Riots side instead of being in the dark and complaining all by myself.

Of course - you had some valid points, and you presented it all in a well-versed manner. ^-^ I wouldn't consider this complaining by any means, trust me, I've seen complaining. :P 

Seriously, though, it stems from passion either way. If you didn't care, you wouldn't have taken the time to write a thought out response. 

You've got some awesome ideas! I'd love to see more of your feedback and conversations in the future! :D

In short, if I want to be a true badass, I might as well dive in to enemy base if i want to be a true badass, or I can just tower hug my own if I want to keep it off. This is going to be cancerous LOL.

Pushing ideas for the sake of pushing ideas tends to be a bad idea.  

[Check out lesson 12.](http://www.gdcvault.com/play/1023186/Twenty-Years-Twenty)  I'd also suggest this is a mistake in terms of lesson one and seven.  If a champion has a functionality (toggling the hood), then there are going to be people who want that as an option they can control.  Some people will always want it on... or off.  

So what you are doing is adding something cool to the game that doesn't effect gameplay or balance and then locking it away "behind features" "because reasons".  

I mean this is a mistake because it also goes against the reason why skins exist: people want a customized visual experience.  Now you are asking us to pay 20 bucks for what amounts to a terrible design mistake because someone's ego wanted to make a mistake.
Players will prefer the option to choose in 100% of cases.

That is true and will leave room for Riot to progress in certain ways. But they should try it on some other champions that isn't quite as popular as Ashe and be experimental with them. There is a reason why Ashe is like getting her 10th skin vs. other champions like jayce/quinn/rumble and etc who has less than 5 skins available (not counting legacy skins of course) because based on my shared opinions, Riot is just doing what generates more revenue.
Haha, I guess oh wells. Thank you for everything then! Great skin anyway tho.
